occupation: Executive Vice President, Social Impact & ESG at Paramount
headline: Executive Vice President, Social Impact & Environmental Social and Governance (ESG) at Paramount
location_str: New York, New York, United States

experiences.title: Executive Vice President, Social Impact & ESG
Senior Vice President, Social Responsibility & Environmental Social and Governance (ESG)
Senior Vice President, Culture, Corporate Social Responsibility, ESG Strategy & Reporting
Senior Vice President, Global Responsibility & Sustainability;Executive Director, Nielsen Foundation
Vice President, Global Responsibility and Sustainability
Director, Industry Relations, Global Marketing
experiences.description:
Develop and manage strategic alliances with industry and business associations within the global business community. 

Grow and expand the reach of Nielsen’s thought leadership efforts across the media and consumer industries, focusing on the increasingly diverse, demanding and connected consumer.

experiences.title: Director, Client Communications & Business Initiatives
experiences.description:
Lead client communications process including - draft, edit and approve client communications content,  manage execution of communication releases, and streamline and create new processes for enhanced communication, distribution, and internal education.

Work collaboratively with Client Services, Corporate Communications Stakeholder and Media Relations Center of Excellence (COE) to develop and execute communications strategy for multiple media business.

Develop market growth strategy based on media client insights working with Marketing and Product Leadership teams.

experiences.title: Director, Public Affairs, Nielsen
experiences.description:
Create and execute strategic communications and public relations plan including community, government and civic outreach initiatives across the United States. 

Produce and execute go-to-market strategy and education campaign focused the Nielsen brand , its innovative solutions and keen understanding of communities and consumer behavior.

Coordinate and oversee external independent advisory council consisting of industry, community and business leaders, to inform and enhance efforts with recruitment, measurement and accurate reporting of ethnic television households in the U.S. 

Design and manage global purchasing assessment for company-wide procurement profitability and efficiency appraisal

accomplishment_publications.name: Nielsen and the World Food Programme: Revolutionizing Data Collection
Moving to Mobile: How Nielsen and WFP Are Revolutionizing Hunger Relief
Suiting Words to Action: How Nielsen Is Using Advertising to Tailor a Nonprofit’s Message

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Advertising Research Foundation Young Pros Award

accomplishment_projects.title: Diverse Intelligence Series: The Power of the Digital Black Consumer
accomplishment_projects.description: Building upon the tremendous success of The Power of the Black Consumer series debut in 2011, we return this year to shift focus and showcase the digital presence in their daily lives. The evening will be an interactive event, highlighted by a panel of senior executives from various industries including Consumer Packaged Goods, Media, Online, Advertiser and Retail. Following the panel, there will be an opportunity for active discussion with panelists and a networking reception.

volunteer_work.title: New York City Department of Education Minority and Women-Owned Business Enterprise Diversity Council

certifications.name: GRI Certified Training Program
certifications.authority: Boston College Center for Corporate Citizenship
